intro: Abies marocana, commonly known as the Moroccan fir, is a species of conifer native to the Atlas Mountains of Morocco. It is a medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters. The tree has needle-like leaves that are dark green on top and whitish underneath, with a distinctive resinous scent. Its cones are cylindrical and hang downward, containing winged seeds. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
